content: within the first 2 decrease row but if that sounds too complicated you could work one spacer round where you work all necessary decreases and then work the toe as directed assuming you have the same number of sts on sole and instep work the toe as follows round1 k to 3 sts before marker k2 decrease k to last st before the first purl section working k tbl where established k2tog tbl work as established until the last p st of the last p section k2 decrease twisted k to 1 st after marker working k tbl where established ssk k to end of round round2 work all sts as established p the purls ktbl the ktbl sts k the sole round3 work all sts as established round4 work all sts as established round5 as round 1 round6 work all sts as established round7 work all sts as established round8 as round 1 round9 work all sts as established round10 work all sts as established round11 as round1 round12 work all sts as established round13 as round1 round14 work all sts as establishedround15 as round1 round16 work all sts as established round17 as round1 keep working round 1 until you have decreased all p sts on the instep you should have a total of 24 sts now repeat the following decrease round until you have a total of 8 sts 4 on each needle decrease round k to 3 sts before marker k2 decrease k1 k1tbl k2tog tbl k tbl until 3 sts before marker k2tog twisted k1 tbl k1 ssk k to end of round cut yarn leaving about 10 inches / 25 cms and graft the toe closed turn sock inside out and darn in both loose threads further suggestions wendel page 5 it is very easy to substitute other types of heel if you prefer just work it instead of the flap + gusset heel described here you will see how the pattern meanders over the instep due to a combination of version a and b feel free to try this on the leg as well remember to work a spacer round if you change from a to b or vice versa as i said before the toe sounds more complicated than it is but there is nothing to prevent you from working a plain stocking st toe of your choice if you are experienced at pattern knitting you will see how the repeat could easily be made bigger or smaller thus enabling a variety of other sizes feel free to experiment with this i have decided not to include these options due to time constraints and not to over-complicate the charts but you are welcome to message me on ravelry if you run into problems with a modified repeat glossary st sts stitch stitches k knit p purl sl slip k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches separately as if to knit insert left needle into these
